questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. A threat actor behind a single computer exploited a cloud-based application by sending multiple concurrent API requests. These requests made the application unresponsive. Which solution protects the application from being overloaded and ensures more equitable application access across the end- user community?
//IMG//

choices.A: Limit the number of API calls that a single client is allowed to make
choices.D: Increase the application cache of the total pool of active clients that call the API
choices.B: Add restrictions on the edge router on how often a single client can access the API
choices.C: Reduce the amount of data that can be fetched from the total pool of active clients that call the API

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Usually customer might not have access to set policies at the router level.
I vote A
Has anyone recently sat this exam, are the questions up to date?

comments.content: Ephert, did you take it? Were the questions similar at all?
Im plannin to write the exam this monthend

discussion.content: Limit the number of API calls that a single client is allowed to make

Selected Answer: A
. Limit the number of API calls that a single client is allowed to make

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which two steps mitigate attacks on the webserver from the Internet? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Implement a reverse server in the DMZ network
choices.D: Move the webserver to the internal network
choices.A: Create an ACL on the firewall to allow only TLS 1.3
choices.E: Move the webserver to the external network
choices.C: Create an ACL on the firewall to allow only external connections

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
how to stop attacks from internet...1 get it off the internet, so move to intranet..

Selected Answer: BD
ChatGPT: Implementing a reverse server in the DMZ network (Option B): This helps to shield the internal network from direct exposure to the internet. The reverse server acts as an intermediary between the internal web server and external users, reducing the risk of attacks reaching sensitive internal resources.

Moving the web server to the external network (Option E): By placing the web server on the external network (like a demilitarized zone, DMZ), it is isolated from the internal network and better protected from attacks aimed at internal systems.

The two steps that mitigate attacks on the webserver from the Internet are:

A. Create an ACL on the firewall to allow only TLS 1.3: Transport Layer Security (TLS) is a protocol that provides secure communication between web servers and clients over the internet. By creating an Access Control List (ACL) on the firewall to allow only TLS 1.3, the web server can be configured to only accept secure connections from clients. This helps to protect against attacks that try to intercept or eavesdrop on communications.

B. Implement a reverse server in the DMZ network: A reverse proxy server acts as an intermediary between the internet and the web server. It receives all incoming traffic and then forwards it to the web server. By implementing a reverse server in the DMZ network, the web server can be protected from direct exposure to the internet. The reverse proxy server can perform functions such as filtering traffic, caching data, and providing an additional layer of security by masking the web server's IP address.

Selected Answer: AB
Create an ACL on the firewall to allow only TLS 1.3
Implement a proxy server in the DMZ network not sure why they mentioned reverse server... 

AB is correct

comments.content: how it related to question? are you bot?

discussion.content:
https://resources.infosecinstitute.com/topic/what-is-enumeration/
Enumeration is defined as a process which establishes an active connection to the target hosts to discover potential attack vectors in the system, and the same can be used for further exploitation of the system.

Selected Answer: AB
A and B

You cant use an ACL on a firewall to force TLS 1.3. Thats not a thing
and FirePower doesnt support TLS 1.3
Only allowing TLS 1.3 can mitigate attacks, the proxy server can also help. C might cause issues for internal users, and D doen't do anything to mitigate attacks. Ans is: A.B.

comments.content: Is there a way to configure the firewall that can only accept TLS 1.3? by allowing the TLS 1.3 only on a load balancer might cause an issue as well.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is investigating a case with suspicious usernames within the active directory. After the engineer investigates and cross-correlates events from other sources, it appears that the 2 users are privileged, and their creation date matches suspicious network traffic that was initiated from the internal network 2 days prior. Which type of compromise is occurring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The creation of privileged user accounts in the Active Directory that coincide with suspicious network traffic suggests a network compromise. This type of activity is often indicative of an attacker gaining sufficient access to create accounts with elevated privileges, which can be used for further malicious activities within the network. The cross-correlation of events from other sources that align with the timing of these account creations strengthens the case for a compromised network. This scenario is consistent with tactics used by attackers to maintain persistence and establish control over network resources for ongoing exploitation1.
Compromised insider - ChatGPT

choices.A: high risk level, anomalous periodic communication, quarantine with antivirus
choices.D: high risk level, malicious host, investigate further
choices.B: critical risk level, malicious server IP, run in a sandboxed environment
choices.C: critical risk level, data exfiltration, isolate the device

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. For IP 192.168.1.209, what are the risk level, activity, and next step?
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I would go with A, as Malicious Host is not an ACTIVITY

Based on the information provided, it is not possible to identify the specific Cisco dashboard used in this display. However, based on the information provided, the risk level is high, and the activity is anomalous periodic communication, suggesting that there is suspicious activity occurring between the host at IP address 192.168.1.209 and a known malicious host identified as #CSAL01.

The recommended next step is to quarantine the host at IP address 192.168.1.209 with antivirus software. This is because there is a high risk of malware infection from the communication with the malicious host, and antivirus software can help detect and remove any malware that may be present.

Therefore, the answer is option A: high risk level, anomalous periodic communication, quarantine with antivirus. - ChatGPT
D. high risk level, malicious host, investigate further

Selected Answer: D
D. high risk level, malicious host, investigate further
B. Allow
B. allowed by a configured access policy rule [Allow ICMP].
Answer B is correct

Selected Answer: D
D. allowed in the default action

choices.A: blocked by a configured access policy rule
choices.B: allowed by a configured access policy rule
choices.C: blocked by an intrusion policy rule
